The specific sequence we are interested in is HHH (for the first 3 flips) followed by TT (for the last 2 flips). 

The probability of this specific sequence occurring is calculated as follows:

\[
P(HHH \, TT) = P(H) \times P(H) \times P(H) \times P(T) \times P(T)
\]

\[

\]

This simplifies to:

\[
P(HHH \, TT) = \left(\frac{1}{2}\right)^5 = \frac{1}{32}
\]

Thus, the probability that the coin will land heads up on the first 3 flips and not on the last 2 flips is \( \frac{1}{32} \).

The correct option is:

e) \( \frac{1}{32} \)
